definition: lit. a brick thrown to prompt others to produce a jade (idiom)/fig. a modest suggestion intended to prompt others to come forward with better ideas

to draw (e.g. a bow)/to pull/to stretch sth/to extend/to lengthen/to involve or implicate in/to attract/to lead/to guide/to leave/to provide evidence or justification for/old unit of distance equal to 10 丈[zhang4], one-thirtieth of a km or 33.33 meters
lit. throw out a brick and get jade thrown back (idiom)/fig. to attract others' interest or suggestions by putting forward one's own modest ideas to get the ball rolling
to venture to/to presume to/to take the liberty of
to just talk for the sake of talking
my limited view (lit. view through a thin tube)/my limited understanding/my opinion (humble)
my unworthy manuscript (humble expr.)/my humble writing
my unworthy manuscript (humble expr.)/my humble writing
learned person/expert in a certain field/abbr. to 方家[fang1 jia1]
to provide as expedient/to use temporarily as/to make shift
in order to minimally fulfill one's responsibilities/in order to get off the hook
